title: Quiz 3: Food Handling and Safety
description: Test your understanding of food hygiene, preservation techniques, and safety regulations.

questions.question: What is the recommended minimum height for storing bagged foods above the floor to ensure proper hygiene?
questions.explanation: Bagged foods should be stored at least 18 inches off the ground to allow for cleaning underneath and inspection for pests.

questions.question: The food preservation method that involves heating food to 70-100°C for a short time to inactivate enzymes is called ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Blanching inactivates enzymes and drives out air bubbles, often done before freezing or drying.

questions.question: Which of the following are principles of food preservation? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Preservation involves killing microbes (heat), slowing them down (cold), or making the environment unsuitable (drying/salting).
questions.hint: Think about heat, cold, and water.

questions.question: Match the causative agent with the food-borne disease:
questions.explanation: Specific pathogens cause specific diseases: Salmonella->Typhoid, Vibrio->Cholera, Brucella->Brucellosis.
questions.hint: Look for similar names in the bacteria and disease.

questions.question: Which Part of the Public Health Act (Cap 242) specifically deals with the 'Protection of foodstuffs'?
questions.explanation: Part X (10) regulates the construction of buildings for food storage and prohibits sleeping in kitchens.

questions.question: How does salting work as a food preservation method?
questions.explanation: Salt creates a hypertonic environment, drawing water out of microbial cells via osmosis, which kills or inhibits them.

questions.question: Freezing food at 0-4°C kills all bacteria immediately.
questions.explanation: False. Freezing inhibits or slows down bacterial growth and multiplication but does not necessarily kill them immediately.
questions.hint: Does cold kill or just stop growth?

questions.question: Which of the following personal hygiene practices is CRITICAL for food handlers?

options.text: Working while suffering from a cold

questions.explanation: Short, clean nails prevent the harboring of dirt and bacteria that can contaminate food.

questions.question: Arrange the steps for hygienic food handling in a logical order:
questions.explanation: Hygiene starts with the handler (hands), then the food (cleaning), then processing (cooking), and finally serving.
